title: They're Toast!
question_text:
A company has two assembly lines for making toasters. One assembly line (line A) has been producing $2\%$ of its toasters as defective while the other assembly line (line B) has been producing $4\%$ defective. The company president is unhappy about this and wants to randomly sample $500$ toasters from each assembly line.
What is the probability, to the nearest whole percent, of line B producing more than $3\%$ defective toasters than line A?
